trustfund: TF025614-PHRD-RURAL & MAIN ROADS PROJECT,TF039711-HONDURAS - RURAL AND MAIN ROADS.,TF037134-HONDURAS - RURAL AND MAIN ROADS PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Reconstruction and Improvement
            Project, will restore those roads damaged by Hurricane
            Mitch, improve trade corridors, and establish financial, and
            institutional frameworks for the road sub-sector. Project
            components include: 1) road reconstruction, rehabilitation,
            and improvement, covering sections of the main Central
            America corridor, roads connecting neighboring countries,
            and roads located in the southwestern region of the country,
            known as the "natural corridor". In addition, the
            Santa Rita-Yoro road, the most severely damaged road by
            Hurricane Mitch, will be reconstructed, to include
            replacement of four bridges, retaining walls, and river
            channels. Improvements include sections connecting the
            central part of the country, and the most southern section,
            referred to as the Central Highway; 2) rural roads and
            bridges, involving rehabilitation of high priority rural
            roads, complementing USAID financing in several Departments
            of the country. Environmental mitigation will address part
            of the works; 3) a pilot project on road maintenance, partly
            financed by participating local communities through the
            formation of micro-enterprises, established with
            consultants' assistance; 4) consultant services, and
            technical assistance to supervise works, and strengthen the
            Planning Directorate, and the Road Fund organization; and,
            5) a limited amount of goods, such as equipment, vehicles,
            and computers.
